greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Tree generated by floor(3n/2): a(1) = 1, a(2n) = (3*a(n))-1, a(2n+1) = floor((3*a(n+1))/2).
comment: A permutation of the positive integers. See the comment at A183079. Leftmost branch of tree is essentially A061418. Rightmost: A007051.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192; the first 14 levels of the tree, flattened
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: Let U(n)=3n-1.  U is the complement of L.
The tree-array T(n,k) is then given by rows:
a(2^n) = A007051(n) for all n >= 0. [A property shared with A048673 and A254103.]
mathematica: a[1]=1; a[n_] := a[n] = If[EvenQ[n], 3a[n/2]-1, Floor[3a[(n+1)/2]/2] ]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 02 2018 *)
program: transpose [map a032766 xs, map (a016789 . subtract 1) xs]) [2]
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 06 2017
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 30 2010
ext: Formula to the name-field added by _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 26 2015
